item.title: Report E-2025030233
item.description:
Report E-2025030233

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: CARROLLTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 18, 2025, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately four (4) pounds of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the released product. All spent material and the damaged bags were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 13, 2025, one (1) 4-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all spent material in one (1) 5-gallon pail. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030185
item.description:
Report E-2025030185

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While working in the warehouse at Veolia's ten-day in-transit facility in Arlington, TX, a Veolia employee accidentally knocked over 6 containers that were stacked on top of other containers on a pallet. The impact with the ground caused the lip to pop loose from one container, releasing 6 ounces of material from the package. Trained Veolia employees immediately righted the containers and remediated the release of material using absorbent material on top of the spill. The container was uprighted and the lid was re-secured to the package.

item.title: Report E-2025030256
item.description:
Report E-2025030256

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: DENISON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 89350
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 19, 2025, at 1938 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Denison, Texas regarding the release of Sulfuric Acid 50%. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 775 gallons of Sulfuric Acid 50% (UN2796, 8, II) from (3) 330-gallon plastic totes onto asphalt and an adjacent ditch. The release was reportedly due to a rollover accident, impacting multiple areas of asphalt and soil. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned with absorbents and the proper PPE. Removal of impacted soil is pending future remediation by contractors. All waste generated from the emergency response portion of addressing this release was containerized in (6) 55-gallon DFs which were taken onsite by contractors pending proper disposal.
